relation: Grid and HPC Operations Center of A.U.Th
Lebanon Evangelical School for Boys and Girls
the hub is not public yet
Building packages for local fabric needs. Maintenance of RPM repositories. Monitoring, messaging and information system software for LCG.
Compiling proprietary software across Fedora and RHEL. Both the software and any dependencies that are not available in Fedora and/or RHEL that may also be proprietary.
CERN no longer runs their own Koji, but does make daily use of the one run by the Scientific Computing Center of A.U.Th.
Fast-Track repositories for Enterprise Linux and Fedora, FTBFS, Blog posts on Koji
Packaging commercial and in-house software for RHEL/CentOS/Fedora support. Multiple instances installed, locally and customer sites.
Used to provide configuration RPMS for our three schools

Building and packaging to support local infrastructure as well as incorporate software not packaged at Fedora or RPMFusion. Most packaged software is available to all. See Messinet Secure Services Fedora RPM Repository for details.
Building and packaging on top of RHEL and CentOS 6 for newer software version.
building Spacewalk for RHEL 5, 6, and Fedora 14, 15
used to build rpms that aren't available in the RHEL repos or EPEL
used to build RPMS for the Amazon Linux AMI
Used to build RPMs for the Open Science Grid software project. Software built here is deployed across 100+ universities and labs across the U.S.
Building add-on packages for the RFRemix.
